speaker: Bulldog
text: [_on-air_] ...4 for 17 on Sunday, he calls himself a quarterback? I've passed kidney stones with more accuracy!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Roz, who's just passing by_] Roz, Roz.  Listen, could you go in there and get my briefcase for me?  I was just on my way out but I left it in the studio.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you go get it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, because every time I go in there, he puts me on the air and humiliates me.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, what do you think he does to me?  Last week when I went in to get my car keys he introduced me as Martina Navratilova's girlfriend. [_leaves_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_ringing a cowbell_] Well Chuck, I'm really sorry I offended you. Now why don't you put your skirt back on and do some dishes? _Frasier opens the door and crawls into the studio.  His briefcase is sitting on the console near the door.  As he reaches out for it, Bulldog, who has seen him, picks up the briefcase and moves it to the other side.  Frasier, keeping his head down, reaches a hand over the console and gropes blindly for it._

speaker: Bulldog
text: The lines are open.  And how about some real men calling instead of crybabies like Chuck? _He raps Frasier over the knuckles with his drumstick, making him jump to his feet._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well... look who's just crawled into the doghouse, it's Dr. Frasier Crane!  And you know what we always do when we get a house call from the doctor. [_puts tape in machine_]

speaker: Tape
text: [_Italian_] Dropp-a your pants and bend over, I take-a your temperature.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_holding up briefcase_] So, doc?  Who's your pick for the Giants- Saints game this weekend?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wearily_] The Giants.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You're kidding!

speaker: Frasier
text: The Saints?

speaker: Bulldog
text: You're kidding!

speaker: Frasier
text: Somebody has to win.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah.  They would if the Giants and Saints were playing this weekend! _He plays a tape of a donkey braying, then throws the briefcase to Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that was very funny indeed. I wished you'd played it on my show. It deserves to be heard by a much larger audience. Hee haw!  Hee haw! [_leaves_] **A CHUMP OFF THE OLD BLOCK**  _Scene B: The Frasier Residence. Daphne opens the door to Niles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne. [_indicating package_] I brought this for dinner.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Kinda early.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I just put Maris on the train to Chicago.  And you know how desolate I am without my Maris.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_opening package_] Champagne?

speaker: Niles
text: Goes with all occasions.  Can I be of any assistance in the kitchen?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I have everything well in hand.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, well... lucky everything.

speaker: Niles
text: [_as Martin reaches for a piece_] Uh-uh. [_Martin reaches for another piece_] Mmm-mmm.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, what would you do?

speaker: Niles
text: Well for starters, I'd take that corn-nut off the board.

speaker: Martin
text: That corn-nut's my bishop.  Eddie ate the real one.

speaker: Niles
text: In that case, corn-nut to Rook 7.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello all.

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening, Dr. Crane.  Guess what your brother brought, champagne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Maris left for Chicago already?

speaker: Niles
text: She's riding the rails as we speak.

speaker: Daphne
text: If I may ask, why does she take the train?

speaker: Niles
text: She's been afraid to fly since her harrowing incident.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear.  Did a plane almost crash?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  She was bumped from first class.  She still wakes up screaming.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Frasier, I'm glad you're here, I've got a favour to ask you.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is it, dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know my old buddy from the force Joe Linski's running the benefit for the Widows and Orphans fund this year, and he's doing one of those bachelor auctions and he's out looking for local celebrities and I thought if we could get somebody really famous from the radio station...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, say no more.  I'd be delighted to help.

speaker: Martin
text: Great.  So you'll ask Bulldog tomorrow?

speaker: Frasier
text: ...Bulldog.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Well, you know, don't get me wrong, I was going to ask you too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm-hmm?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah I was, I was.  I was just saving the best for last.

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Frasier, give him a break.  If he backpedals any faster, he'll trip over his walker.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'll do it.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, great!  I really appreciate it... you won't forget to ask Bulldog, will ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll leave a note on his hydrant.

speaker: Daphne
text: A bachelor auction. I've always thought it would be fun to pick a man off the block to do my bidding and fulfill my every desire. [_then_] Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: [_from his private little world_] I'd love to. [_realises Daphne is offering him some champagne_] I mean, ah... Frasier?  I was just thinking, what if no-one bids?  What if you're left standing there, with flop sweat trickling down your back, amidst a great, gaping silence.

speaker: Martin
text: It'll never happen, Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, we got a band! **GOING ONCE**  _Scene C: Backstage at the bachelor auction.  Frasier and Bulldog are listening to the screams of the audience._

speaker: Announcer
text: [_offstage, or rather, on stage, if you know what I mean_] Our next bachelor on the block is public television's own cute and cuddly Mr. Science.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God!  The estrogen levels are off the charts out there!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, isn't it great?  I mean, deep down, chicks are just like guys.  We all want the same thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've got news for them: Frasier Crane does not put out. All they're getting for their little donation is a well- prepared gourmet meal and a handshake at the door.

speaker: Bulldog
text: BORING!  My date gets a stretch limo, moon roof, dinner, floor seats at the Sonics game and these incredible buns of steel. [_turns around_] Feel 'em, doc.  Come on, feel 'em!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, no!

speaker: Announcer
text: Please, please. Keep articles of clothing off the stage!

speaker: Martin
text: Man, you show these women a little celebrity beefcake and they go nutso.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't mind telling you dad, I'm a little bit nervous. This is a textbook case of mob mentality.  I hope all the fire exits are clearly marked.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, relax, relax, will ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, that's easy for you to say.  You're not the one jumping into the Rottweiler pit with a pork chop around your neck!

speaker: Martin
text: [_spotting a celebrity_] Hey Frasier, that's T.J. Smith, he's a linebacker for the Seahawks.  They call him "The Enforcer," he's put two quarterbacks in hospital already this season. [_goes over to T.J._] Hey, T.J.!  Marty Crane, nice to meet ya.

speaker: Manager
text: Number 19?

speaker: T.J.
text: [_to Martin_] Please don't make me go out there.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you'll be fine.  Don't worry, just go on out there and have a good time.

speaker: Martin
text: They're gonna have him for breakfast. **GOING TWICE**

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, T.J.  How was it, man?

speaker: T.J.
text: It was horrible. They're like sharks at a feeding frenzy. The one who bought me had this crazed look in her eye.

speaker: Roz
text: Where do I pay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: I saw what I wanted and I went after it. [_T.J. makes to back off_] Stay!

speaker: Manager
text: Number 20? [_this is Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nervously_] That's me.

speaker: Martin
text: You know son, I haven't had a chance to tell you how much I appreciate this.  You know, having somebody like you in the auction really adds class.

speaker: Frasier
text: My pleasure, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, if the bidding gets slow, drop a quarter and take a couple of minutes to pick it up.  **...GONE**

speaker: Announcer
text: Sold!  To that very determined lady in the back row for five hundred dollars.

speaker: Bulldog
text: So Doc, who bought ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no idea.  Last thing I remember is someone shouting out, "Shake your money maker."

speaker: Manager
text: Number 21? [_that's Bulldog_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ladies!  Start your engines! [_exits_]

speaker: Christina
text: Dr. Crane?  Christina Harper.  I just bought you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You?  You?  You... bought me.

speaker: Christina
text: I listen to your show all the time, I'm a big fan of yours.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how... wonderful.  Ah, you bought me for, for five hundred dollars.  That's a lot of money.

speaker: Christina
text: Oh, that's all right, I just did a big layout for "Seattle Style."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, are you a photographer?

speaker: Christina
text: No, I'm a model.

speaker: Frasier
text: A model!  How wonderful.  For you.

speaker: Christina
text: So um, how about Friday?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Friday's fine.  I live at the Elliot Bay Towers on the Counterbalance.  Ah, around seven?

speaker: Christina
text: Sounds great.  See you then.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_happily_] That's my new owner.  She's a model.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No kidding, she almost put my eye out.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you're back awfully quick.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey-hey!  I was one of the last guys out there!  The money was running low, but! - there was still one rawhide chew toy out there for the Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_leaves, saying to her as he slaps her behind_] I gotta take a squirt.  When I come back, we'll play fetch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, Daphne.  Why?

speaker: Daphne
text: Things were slowing down, so your father asked me to shill. I opened at a hundred dollars, who knew that would be the only bid? _FADE TO:  Scene B: The Frasier Residence. Frasier is making the final touches for his date.  He wheels a restaurant cart out to the living room.  The doorbell bing-bongs.  Frasier answers it to-_

speaker: Frasier
text: Christina.  _Buenas noches._

speaker: Christina
text: Hi, Frasier.  Sorry I'm late, but I got a last minute call for a job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well that's all right, you're here now, and you look enchanting.

speaker: Christina
text: No, you don't understand.  The job's tonight. But we could have dinner later.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well I suppose that's all right.

speaker: Christina
text: I hope you didn't go to too much trouble?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no-no-no-no-no.

speaker: Christina
text: [_looking at room_] You rented a restaurant trolley.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I own it.  Don't tell me that you don't have one?

speaker: Christina
text: There's just one more thing.  Um, my friend Sandy got called in on the same job, and she was supposed to look after my daughter.  _She indicates the corridor.  Frasier looks out to find a young girl standing there._

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't tell me you want me to babysit?

speaker: Christina
text: Look, I wouldn't do this, but I'm really in a jam.  Look, Sandy'll take her as soon as we get back, and umm, that'll leave just the two of us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Christina, I'm not really sure if I can...

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll make a _lot_ of points for this, won't I?

speaker: Christina
text: A ton.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bring the darling in.

speaker: Christina
text: Dr. Crane, this is my daughter Renata.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello. [_she says nothing_]

speaker: Christina
text: She's shy at first.  See you later.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... come on in, have a seat.  Can I get you, um, a soft drink?  Goose liver pate?  Renata, that's a pretty name. I suppose it has some poetic, romantic significance...

speaker: Renata
text: Can I use your phone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Renata.  We're going to be spending the evening together, let's try to make the best of it, shall we?  I may surprise you, you know.  I'm probably more "with it" than you think I am... the phone's right there.    **SHRINK RAP**  _Scene A: Time Lapse at Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is at the table, Renata is throwing treats to Eddie whilst talking to her friend on the phone._

speaker: Renata
text: No way!  That is so fresh.  No way.  No way.  No... way.  Hold on, there's another call. [_changes lines_] He'll call you back. [_switches back_] No way...

speaker: Frasier
text: Who was that?

speaker: Renata
text: I don't know. [_into phone_] No way!  Oh god, another call's coming in.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking phone_] Do you mind?  I'll answer this one, thank you. Hello? [_gives phone back_] It's for you.

speaker: Renata
text: Hello?  Hey, Tiffany.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tiffany?  I thought you just spoke to Tiffany?

speaker: Renata
text: That was Tiffany Schwartz.  This is Tiffany Martinez.

speaker: Frasier
text: Celebrate the ethnic mosiac that is America, but nonetheless... [_takes phone and hangs up_]

speaker: Renata
text: What's your damage?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll tell you what my damage is, young lady.  You've been Talking on the phone for an hour and a half.  You haven't said a word to me except to ask for more Cheetos. [_Eddie barks_] They're coming, Eddie!

speaker: Renata
text: Excuse me.  Like I'm supposed to be happy I'm here?  Her Fabulousness dumps me with a total stranger who could be a total perv.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not exactly thrilled about it either, but your mother was in a bind.  And for the record, I am not a perv.

speaker: Renata
text: You don't get it.  She is always doing stuff like this.  She's a flake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nonetheless, flake or not, you are in my charge.  I think it's Time you had something that was a bit more nutritious.  Now, how about some seafood crepes?  Lobster Neuberg? [_gives up_] Corn dog dipped in curare?  [_N.B. Curare - a VERY powerful neurotoxin found in South America._]

speaker: Renata
text: You got any raw cookie dough?

speaker: Frasier
text: Even more lethal.  Yes, just come on into the kitchen, we'll See what we've got.

speaker: Renata
text: You know, you wouldn't have gotten anywhere with this gourmet Meal routine.  She eats like, nothing.  She's a total diet freak.  That's all she talks about, besides herself.

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't care much for your mother, do you?

speaker: Renata
text: Well, duh.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I have a son.  I'd hate to think by the time he's your age, he thinks of me as some sort of, um...

speaker: Renata
text: Dweeb?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Renata
text: Brace yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, look what we have here. [_pulls a packet of cookie dough from the freezer_] Will one tube suffice?

speaker: Frasier
text: Put that in your pipe and smoke it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well now, Renata, you know, I am a psychiatrist.  And um, if you're having problems with your mother I'd be glad to listen.

speaker: Renata
text: You mean you want me to tell you all my problems like those Gomers on your show?  Like you care.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do care about the Gomers.  I even care about you.

speaker: Renata
text: Don't make me hurl! [_Frasier gives up and sits down_] She keeps telling people I'm younger than I am.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why do you think she does that?

speaker: Renata
text: So they won't know how old she is. I've been nine for the past three years.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Renata
text: That's nothing.  Once, she promised to take me ice-skating for my birthday?  On the way there she saw a tattoo parlor.  So she just left me out on the sidewalk 'til she could get a stupid butterfly tattooed on her shoulder.  It's like she forgot I was even out there.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God!  How old were you?

speaker: Renata
text: That was the first time I was nine.

speaker: Frasier
text: What does your father say about all this?

speaker: Renata
text: Tony?  He's on the road with Whitesnake all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Whitesnake?  Is that a musical group or a pet?

speaker: Renata
text: It's his new wife. **DRIVING MISS DAPHNE**  _Scene B: Back of Bulldog's stretch limo. He and Daphne are leaving the game.  Daphne is a little tipsy._

speaker: Daphne
text: I must confess, I was a little apprehensive about going out with you tonight. But I'm actually having a jolly time.  Unless of course it's the champagne getting to me.  I have had quite a bit, haven't I?  Oh, who cares?  That's the beauty of being in a limo.  Unless of course the driver's drinking. [_into intercom_] You're not drinking, are you? [_to Bulldog_] He's not drinking.  Let's drink to the driver not drinking.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Man, you're really looped, this is great.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's annoying, isn't it?  Certainly is taking a long time getting out of this parking lot.  Did I mention this was my first basketball game?  Yes, of course I did, three or four times.  I still can't get over those players.  They are positively gigantic.  Not that being tall is the only measure of a man... but it's a bloody good one. [_bursts out laughing_] Oh dear, I just insulted you, didn't I?  Sorry.  Oh well, you can take it, you're a tough little nut.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear.  This is not good.  Not good at all.

speaker: Bulldog
text: What, you don't like the champagne?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I can see the bottom of me glass.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_refilling Daphne's glass_] Well, bottoms up!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you are a naughty boy.  Now don't go getting any ideas. Oh, look who I'm saying this to.  You don't have an idea in your head! [_laughs_] Did it again.  I insulted you.  Let's drink to that.  Boom!  _She knocks her glass on Bulldog's forehead.  Outside, the car horns start up again._

speaker: Daphne
text: Now that is downright rude. [_lowers window and yells through a speaker-cone_] Hey, you there!  You in the Firebird!  Yes, you! Stop that honking!  Now, now, just because you look stupid doesn't mean you have to act stupid!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey!  Don't aggravate him, we're kinda pinned in here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, posh!  Civilization's not going to progress one iota unless someone points out when people's manners are remiss. [_from outside we hear someone shouting, "Move it!"_] OH, SHUT YOUR BLOODY CAKEHOLE!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Don't do that! [_looks out_] Great, now he's getting out of his car!

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh, he's a tall one too.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Quick, roll up your window, lock the door.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't be stupid, he's not going to hurt a woman.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Just roll it up, roll it up!

speaker: Daphne
text: Get your bloody claws off him!  Let him go, you big ugly oaf!

speaker: Bulldog
text: SHUT UP!!! _He gets pulled out of the car while Daphne waves her fists, shadow- boxing.  As his door slams, the limo starts to roll._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.  Well, we're moving. [_through the speaker-cone, to Bulldog outside_] Thank you, Pitbull!  I had a lovely time!  _She falls over while attempting to finish the champagne.  FADE TO:_  _Scene C: Frasier's Apartment. He and Renata are sitting at the dinner table, eating the cookie dough._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, this cookie dough is not that bad.  Of course, I'm Sure later I'll be hurling. [_the doorbell bing bongs_] Ah, that must be Her Fabulousness.  Want to take the rest home with you?

speaker: Renata
text: I'd better not.  If I gain an ounce, she goes ballistic.  She makes me weigh in every morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: You poor thing!

speaker: Renata
text: I'm used to it.

speaker: Christina
text: Hi, I'm back. [_kisses Frasier_] Renata, honey. [_kisses her_] Sandy's waiting downstairs in the car.

speaker: Frasier
text: Renata, I must say I had a rather enjoyable evening.

speaker: Renata
text: You don't get out much, do you? [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I think she likes me.

speaker: Christina
text: Well uh, thank you for helping me out.  Now, roll out that trolley, I'm starving.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Christina, I don't think so.  I think you ought to go home and spend the evening with your daughter.

speaker: Christina
text: But I thought we had a date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, when we first met, I was, well, attracted by your remarkable beauty. But now that I know a bit more about you, well suddenly you don't look so good, sister.

speaker: Christina
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Frasier
text: A daughter is a privilege, not an inconvenience.  You don't Leave her standing on some street corner while you're inside getting tattooed!  Or keep her in some ageless Never-never Land where everyone is nine for ever and ever!

speaker: Christina
text: Renata told you I did that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  She also told me about the morning weigh-in's.  And the time you left her with the coat-check girl at the Palladium, so you could go dancing!  I mean, what kind of excuse for a mother are you, anyway?

speaker: Christina
text: Well.  Did it ever occur to you that she might be lying? 'Cause this is the first night I've been out in over a year. God knows John and Maryanne never take her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who are they?

speaker: Christina
text: Her father and his new wife.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, who are Tony and Whitesnake?

speaker: Christina
text: Our two dogs.  Do you know what I do most nights?  I stay home.  And I help her with her homework, or French lessons. Oh, except last Saturday, when I took her and her twelve friends to an ice-skating party.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't suppose there's any chance that during that party you got your shoulder tattooed?

speaker: Christina
text: [_lowers her coat and turns round_] Do you see anything there? _Of course, Frasier sees no tattoo -- only the smooth, flawless skin of her back -- which, he realizes, is all he'll ever see of her._

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  But then my eyes are tearing up.  But why would she lie?

speaker: Christina
text: Because she's twelve, and she's mad at me.  She wanted to stay home alone, and I wouldn't let her.  I probably would have been better off if I had.  God, some shrink you are!

speaker: Frasier
text: Please don't go, child development is not my thing.  My specialty is adult relations.

speaker: Christina
text: Well, you won't be having any of those tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Christina, please don't go, I...

speaker: Christina
text: [_getting into lift_] Oh, and by the way - I only have one kidney.  Guess who has the other?  _Frasier absorbs this parting shot with a mortified look, as the elevator doors close.  FADE TO:  Scene D: Time lapse.  Frasier's Apartment. He's sharing the cookie dough with Eddie -- and we do mean sharing. He takes a bite, then lowers it for Eddie to lick and nibble. Then, beyond caring, he takes another bite himself.  Martin enters._

speaker: Martin
text: Is the coast clear?  What happened to the supermodel?

speaker: Frasier
text: She left.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Was kinda afraid I might walk in on an embarrassing moment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Should have been here half an hour ago.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, your date's left, what are you doing still sitting up?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was wondering if my sweet little boy's going to turn out to be a monster when he's twelve.

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell brought that up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's a long story.  Do you really want to hear it?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it is getting late.  Look, all kids are the same.  They start out cute, then somewhere along the way they get into that obnoxious, know-it-all stage and you think they'll never grow out of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: But eventually they do?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm still hoping.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Oh, Daphne.  How was your evening? ...No way!
